projDesc: Full stack React application allowing users to securely log in and create their own websites without having to write any code. Users gain access to components leveraging React’s state management for advanced functionality such as regex-based string analyzation on top of 6 professionally designed CSS themes.

techs.desc: the standard markup language for documents designed to be displayed in a web browser.
a style sheet language used for describing the presentation of a document written in a markup language such as HTML.
a programming language that is one of the core technologies of the World Wide Web, alongside HTML and CSS.

open source software for distributed version control: tracking changes in any set of files, usually used for coordinating work among programmers collaboratively developing source code during software development.
a NoSQL database program, MongoDB uses JSON-like documents with optional schemas.
a domain-specific language used in programming and designed for managing data held in a relational database management system, or for stream processing in a relational data stream management system.
an application programming interface (API or web API) that conforms to the constraints of REST architectural style and allows for interaction with RESTful web services.
an open-source, cross-platform, back-end JavaScript runtime environment that runs on the V8 engine and executes JavaScript code outside a web browser
an open-source data query and manipulation language for APIs, and a runtime for fulfilling queries with existing data.
a free and open-source front-end JavaScript library maintained by Meta (Facebook) for building user interfaces based on UI components.
an open-source model–view–viewmodel front end JavaScript framework for building user interfaces and single-page applications.
a frontend framework built upon Vue. js that offers great development features such as server side rendering, automatically generated routes, improved meta tags managing and SEO improvement.
a highly customizable utility-first CSS framework for rapidly building custom user interfaces.
a collaborative browser-based interface design and prototyping tool.
a software application for creating drawings, illustrations, and artwork using vector graphics technology.

Photoshop is a photo editing and raster graphic design software which allows users to create, edit, and manipulate various graphics as well as digital art. It also allows to create and edit raster images with multiple layers in various file formats.
a proposed Internet standard for creating data with optional signature and/or optional encryption whose payload holds JSON that asserts some number of claims.

a programming language developed and maintained by Microsoft. It is a strict syntactical superset of JavaScript and adds optional static typing to the language. It is designed for the development of large applications and transpiles to JavaScript.

a JavaScript testing framework designed to ensure correctness of any JavaScript codebase. It enables developers to write tests with an approachable, familiar and feature-rich API that produces results quickly. Jest is well-documented, requires little configuration and can be extended to match various requirements.

a visual software development platform. Builder serves as a CMS allowing customization and configurization by web developers, while giving drag-and-drop controls to non-developers in the team. Configuration by the developer ensures work performed by other team members fits within the brand and feel of the company.

a type of application software delivered through the web, built using common web technologies including HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and WebAssembly. The end result is a web application that looks and behaves as if it were a native application
